item.title: Signing commits in Git using SSH keys on Windows
item.description: Signing commits in Git is a way to verify the authenticity and integrity of your commits. This ensures that the commits are indeed made by you and have not been tampered with. On Windows, it's easy to set up SSH-Agent for easy signature. Here's how you can do it. First, you need to install SSH on Windows. item.title: Reading USN Journal with .NET
item.description: If you want to detect when a file is created, modified, or deleted, you can use the FileSystemWatcher class in .NET. However, this is only available when the application is running. What if you want to detect changes that occurred while the application was not running?
